Sharing Folders or Items

When you use the View Comparison utility, you can share child folders or items that exist in only one of the selected folders.

When the source view has been set to a fixed configuration (a label, promotion state or date/time), folders and items that are shared to the target view are pinned to that configuration time in the target.

To share child folders or items:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Click a tab on the lower pane to display child folders or items of a specific type.

  4. Select one or more items from the item pane. At least one item must be different from the others. If you are sharing tasks or topics, you can select only one item. Because tasks and topics are in tree form, sharing a task or topic shares its children as well.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • From the Item or context menu, select Share Items.

    • Click the Share Items button on the toolbar.

    The system displays the following message: Share selected items that do not exist in both views?

  6. Click OK. A progress bar indicates how the operation is proceeding.

    7. The selected items that appeared in only one folder are identical now and in both folders. Depending upon your display setting, they may no longer be visible in the item pane.

Note: When folders, files, or change requests are shared into a view, they acquire the branching behavior specified for items shared in that view. This branching behavior is a view property setting.
